entry.tran: 二等的;无足轻重的;地位低下的
entry.def: If someone treats you as a second-class citizen, they treat you as if you are less valuable and less important than other people.

example.ex: Too many airlines treat our children as second-class citizens.
example.tran: 太多的航空公司把我们的孩子当作二等公民对待。

entry.def: If you describe something as second-class, you mean that it is of poor quality.

example.ex: I am not prepared to see children in some parts of this country having to settle for a second-class education.
example.tran: 我没有料到会发现在这个国家的一些地区孩子们只能接受二流的教育。

entry.def: The second-class accommodation on a train or ship is the ordinary accommodation, which is cheaper and less comfortable than the first-class accommodation.

example.ex: He sat in the corner of a second-class carriage...
example.tran: 他坐在一节二等车厢的角落里。

example.ex: Seven second-class passengers prepared to disembark.
example.tran: 7 名普通舱的旅客准备下船。

entry.tran: (邮件)第二类的,(英国)廉价慢递的,(美国)投递报刊的
entry.def: In Britain, second-class postage is the slower and cheaper type of postage. In the United States, second-class postage is the type of postage that is used for sending newspapers and magazines.

example.tran: 第二类邮件所贴的邮票

entry.tran: (英国的大学学位)二级优等的
entry.def: In Britain, a second-class degree is a good university degree, but not as good as a first-class degree.

example.ex: A second-class honours degree is the minimum requirement.
example.tran: 至少须获得二级优等荣誉学位。

auth_sentence.content: Long journeys can be harrowing in second class carriages.
auth_sentence.res_content: Long journeys can be harrowing in second class carriages.

auth_sentence.content: Even people with big stores were only second class.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even people with big stores were only second class.
